snippet: Instead of playing political games, Congress needs to think hard about the best way to support a verifiable nuclear pact.
abstract: Editorial warns that proposed Senate bill from critics of possible international agreement to limit Iran's nuclear program could scuttle emerging deal; adds that bill would also bar Pres Obama from easing sanctions on Iran for 65 days and eliminate executive authority he used in 2013 to lift sanctions, jeopardizing America's credibility; urges Congress to stop playing political games with foreign policy.
lead_paragraph: Instead of playing political games, Congress needs to think hard about the best way to support a verifiable nuclear pact.
